channel.title: Multiple Characters
channel.description:
Jagex always freaks over trading items between your own accounts, it's 'unfair'? I don't know. I think they should support it. You worked hard for the items and you deserve to have them! This is my suggestion:
Jagex enable multiple characters from one account. Example:
You log into Runescape to find yourself at a character screen with 2 characters, your main and a pure. You've decided, "I'm gonna make a skiller!". So you make the account but unfortunately, at level 3 money making is quite difficult with all of your skills at level 1. So, you go in game on your main account and head to the bank. You have 2 tabs in your bank account, 'Bank' and 'Storage'. Bank is your own personal bank for that character, storage on the other hand is shared between each of your characters, each of them can have access to it. So you put... 100k gp into the storage and transfer it over to your skill, where you begin your ever-so fun time being level 3.
Ideas?

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @_CopyRight CopyRight
item.description:
@_CopyRight wrote:

But jagex might forget about the selling thing…

BTW I posted in your rare thing/

item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Lol, ‘lending’. I seen it. It sounds… interesting. But not everybody can play with their friends when they need the items. It should be ‘lend your items until you take back/give back’.

Read full topic

Read the update changes.

EXample, someone lends me a phat, i can use it, but when they log out, they get it back, but they might forget that you can seel the items

Jagex always freaks over trading items between your own accounts, it’s ‘unfair’? I don’t know. I think they should support it. You worked hard for the items and you deserve to have them! This is my suggestion:

Jagex enable multiple characters from one account. Example:

You log into Runescape to find yourself at a character screen with 2 characters, your main and a pure. You’ve decided, “I’m gonna make a skiller!”. So you make the account but unfortunately, at level 3 money making is quite difficult with all of your skills at level 3. So, you go in game on your main account and head to the bank. You have 2 tabs in your bank account, ‘Bank’ and ‘Storage’. Bank is your own personal bank for that character, storage on the other hand is shared between each of your characters, each of them can have access to it. So you put… 100k gp into the storage and transfer it over to your skill, where you begin your ever-so fun time being level 3.

Ideas?

sounds like guild wars[/quote]

yes it does… except in guild wars there is only storage and your inventory.

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

I think it’s a feasible idea, and has a good foundation. And now they are even more susceptible to suggestions, because of the turmoil caused by their shitty updates.

A problem I see is account sharing. Two friends could share an account and they control two separate characters, which could cause problems should one decide to sabotage or whatnot.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

Jagex would have to enforce more rules upon the players, to do with account sharing and the like. Sharing passwords with friends, using memorable but complex passwords… Enough players are hacked as it is;having one main account with ‘sub-accounts’ in it would make the situation even worse.

It’s a good idea though, well done.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

iceburster:

1. How would they find out which accounts to share it with? You’d log on with it?

Pretty sure each character would share something that would point it out if they did something against the rules.

iceburster:

2. It would be undoubtedly EASILY hackable in its release.

Nothing in Runescape is hackable to your knowledge as of today.

iceburster:

3. Jagex would find out some way to ban people doing whatever with this as they banned innocent player for ‘botting’.

They do it anyways, why does it matter?

iceburster:

4. Good luck.

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Taharok, the anti-bot system is quite spectacular. I’m positive if they found a low level botting with a high level main character on the same account, they would ban the entire account, not just one of the characters.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

exe626, did you realize that someone could simply use that system to have a main and several sub accounts that auto items for that main? Jagex would never build something like that.

exe626:

Everybody gives items to their lower levels anyways, this doesn’t change anything. It just keeps people from being banned for such a stupid reason.

Not anymore, they don’t. The new RWT precautions prevent that from being possible.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @Click_Here Click Here
item.description:
@Click_Here wrote:

but knowing jagex, to whiny and bitchy about those ideas, they’ll probaly say some shit like “we want ALL our players to make cash their own way” or along those lines… but if this idea was accepted, it would be V good

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

The only negative thing I can think of at the moment would be “I already have 2 accounts, I don’t want to get rid of one”. Which would make sense to not want to get rid of it, but I see how to fix it.

Ya see, for a certain amount of time you could log into your main account, for say, and from there log into your second account and they be placed together.

Another problem I can see is “That makes lower levels too powerful!”. Everybody gives items to their lower levels anyways, this doesn’t change anything. It just keeps people from being banned for such a stupid reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Characters
item.dc:creator: @Click_Here Click Here
item.description:

sounds good, but there will always be a negative point towards it.

exe626:

I’d imagine that it would have a limit to how many characters you can have on one account whilst banning all of the characters for you macroing.

As much as I am for macroing, I still think that if this idea was implemented that Jagex should ban the entire account instead of just the sub.
